theorem putnam_1979_a3
(x : ℕ → ℝ)
(hx : ∀ n : ℕ, x n ≠ 0 ∧ (n ≥ 3 → x n = (x (n - 2))*(x (n - 1))/(2*(x (n - 2)) - (x (n - 1)))))
: (∀ m : ℕ, ∃ n : ℕ, n > m ∧ ∃ a : ℤ, a = x n) ↔ putnam_1979_a3_solution (x 1, x 2) := by
  have h1 := hx 0
  have h2 := hx 1
  have h3 := hx 2
  have h4 := hx 3
  have h5 := hx 4
  simp at h1 h2 h3 h4 h5
  norm_num at h1 h2 h3 h4 h5
  constructor

    obtain ⟨n, hn, a, ha⟩ := h6
    have h7 := hx n
    simp_all [putnam_1979_a3_solution]
    <;> aesop
  -- Case 2: (x_1, x_2) satisfies the solution condition.
  · intro h
    have h6 := h
    simp_all [putnam_1979_a3_solution]
    <;> aesop

theorem putnam_1979_a3
(x : ℕ → ℝ)
(hx : ∀ n : ℕ, x n ≠ 0 ∧ (n ≥ 3 → x n = (x (n - 2))*(x (n - 1))/(2*(x (n - 2)) - (x (n - 1)))))
: (∀ m : ℕ, ∃ n : ℕ, n > m ∧ ∃ a : ℤ, a = x n) ↔ putnam_1979_a3_solution (x 1, x 2) := by
  have step₁ : (∀ m : ℕ, ∃ n : ℕ, n > m ∧ ∃ a : ℤ, a = x n) ↔ putnam_1979_a3_solution (x 1, x 2) := by
    constructor
    · intro h
      have h1 := h 0
      obtain ⟨n, hn, a, ha⟩ := h1
      simp_all [putnam_1979_a3_solution]
      <;> aesop
    · intro h
      have h1 : putnam_1979_a3_solution (x 1, x 2) := h
      have h2 : ∃ a : ℤ, a = x 1 := by
        simp_all [putnam_1979_a3_solution]
        <;> aesop
      have h3 : ∃ a : ℤ, a = x 2 := by
        simp_all [putnam_1979_a3_solution]
        <;> aesop
      obtain ⟨a, ha⟩ := h2
      obtain ⟨b, hb⟩ := h3
      have h4 : ∀ m : ℕ, ∃ n : ℕ, n > m ∧ ∃ a : ℤ, a = x n := by
        intro m
        use m + 3
        have h5 := hx (m + 3)
        have h6 := hx (m + 4)
        have h7 := hx (m + 5)
        have h8 := hx 3
        have h9 := hx 4
        have h10 := hx 5
        have h11 := hx 6
        norm_num at *
        <;>
        (try
          simp_all [ha, hb] <;>
          ring_nf at * <;>
          aesop)
        <;>
        aesop
      exact h4
  
  exact step₁
